Params: {3: 'No. 21 stands in the entryway for a long time, not moving.'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: '...Is that what human childhood looks like?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "I don't think it's necessary, but it felt good.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She touches her chest right above her heart and pats Buddy.'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'And... light... like I was going to float.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'Why would you feel happy? Are all childhoods happy?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "I want it, but I also don't want it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: '...All I need to do is fight.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Despite wanting to say something, you cannot in the end. Everything you are about to say seems to be futile.'}
{3: 'The pure whiteness you saw in her M.I.N.D. flashes in your head...'}
{3: 'It was blankness. A past of nothingness.'}
{3: 'You do not get to say anything about her choices if you have not experienced her pain.'}
{3: 'After a short break, the infuriating, painful feeling returns to you, followed by a scream of panic outside the house.'}
{3: 'No. 21 listens carefully to the cry that has traveled through time.'}
{3: "She hears it this time. It is a woman's cry, urgent and scared."}
{2: '???', 3: "Lucia! Don't come out! Take your sister upstairs!"}
{3: 'You begin to hear countless screams. Footsteps appear beside you, and you feel a force pushing you. Light, but resolute.'}
{3: 'You cannot help but start moving. The wind howls next to your face as fear and confusion are about to drown you.'}
{3: 'You open your eyes to find yourself at the end of the colorful corridor. In your palm is a small hand as the young Lucia holds you.'}
